page.title: 08Trowlesworthy landscape
page.content:
A Natural. Open moor rises to fissured granite outcrops called tors. The slopes under the tors are covered with boulders called clitter. The river Plym bisects the area and has numerous rough, stony hummocks in its valley caused by ancient tin workings.
B.Farm. The fields are small with stone walls or boundary banks indicating that the settlements are not recent.
C.Industrial. The sides of the waste tips and mica pans are partially landscaped. Where the tipping or banking has finished, the china clay waste is coated with soil and seeded with suitable plants which bind the surface, stopping erosion and vastly improving the appearance as seen from the road.
